page.title: 03DRAMA..ART..ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: Kelty musical produces a yearly show ranging from light opera to musicals, the venue Carnegie Hall, Dunfermline. The production lasts for a week and is usually a sell out. Not only does Kelty have a brass band, it also has a pipe band, both appear at the annual gala along with Kelty majorettes. Gardening allotments still flourish on the outskirts which produce many exhibits for Kelty gardening show held at the Moray Institute. This Institute is the venue for many exhibitions. The most recent "Kelty Past and Present". Kelty has no cinema showing films. It is being used as a "Bingo Hall". An art shop provides the community with art materials and framing facilities. The shop also sells original oil and water colour paintings done by local artists.
